required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation in Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation in Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to provide evidence that Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation is an effective treatment for older adults after disabling medical events.

detailed_description.textblock:
The intervention involves physical and occupational therapy for patients who have been admitted to a skilled nursing facility for therapy following a disabling medical event.
Participants in this study will be randomly assigned to receive either Enhanced or standard of care therapy, meaning they will either receive their PT (Physical Therapy)& OT(Occupational Therapy) from therapists who have been specially trained in the study intervention or from therapists with normal training. Participants will be assessed at baseline, 30, 60, and 90 days after baseline, and at the date of their discharge from the skilled nursing facility.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Discharge, an average of 24 days.
primary_outcome.description: Barthel Index scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating greater levels of function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gait Speed (Determined by 4 or 10 Meter Walk Test)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Discharge, an average of 24 days after baseline.
Discharge, an average of 24 days after baseline.
30, 60, and 90 Days Post Admission to the SNF
secondary_outcome.description: Barthel Index scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating greater levels of function. Conducted as a self-report at timepoints where patient was not in an institutional setting.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Discharge, an average of 24 days after baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants discharged from skilled nursing facility to home

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 30, 60, and 90 post admission to a SNF as well as at Discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses whether the participant was readmitted to the hospital.

intervention.description: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.
Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 65 and older
- Admitted to a skilled nursing facility for post-acute care from PT and OT for 2 weeks or more.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Language, visual or hearing barriers to participation
- Medical illness preventing study participation or accurate data collection
- Moderate-severe dementia (demonstrated by chart diagnosis and/or short blessed score greater than 13)
- Progressive neurological condition such that recovery of function is not feasible
- Patient did not have the ability to walk prior to hospitalization (e.g. paraplegic)
- Schizophrenia or other chronic or current psychotic disorder.

reference.citation: Bland MD, Birkenmeier RL, Barco P, Lenard E, Lang CE, Lenze EJ. Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Effectiveness of a clinical training model. NeuroRehabilitation. 2016 Oct 14;39(4):481-498.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 2 skilled nursing facilities in the St. Louis, Missouri metropolitan area from July 29, 2014 through March 22, 2018.

group.title: Standard of Care Rehabilitation
group.description: Standard of Care Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

group.title: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation
group.description: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.

group.title: Standard of Care Rehabilitation
group.description: Standard of Care Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

group.title: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation
group.description: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Impairment Type
measure.description: Participants' medical conditions were rated by organ system using the Cumulative Illness Rating Scale for Geriatrics (CIRS-G). Participants with extremely severe impairment (CIRSG item score of 4) are tabulated below. Some participants had extremely severe impairment in more than one category.

measure.title: MADRS Score
measure.description: The Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) is a measurement of depressive symptom severity. Scores can range from 0-60 with higher scores indicating more depressive symptoms.

measure.title: Short Blessed Test Score
measure.description: The Short Blessed Test is a measure of cognitive impairment. It is a brief assessment of orientation, registration, and attention. Scores range from 0-28. Higher scores indicate worse impairment, with scores of 5-9 consistent with mild cognitive impairment and scores of at least 10 consistent with dementia.

measure.title: Barthel Index Total Score (Premorbid)
measure.description: The Barthel Index is an instrument that measures a person’s ability to perform 10 basic activities of daily living or mobility items, with a scale range between 0 and 100 (higher scores indicate better function).

measure.title: Barthel Index Total Score (Admission)
measure.description: The Barthel Index is an instrument that measures a person’s ability to perform 10 basic activities of daily living or mobility items, with a scale range between 0 and 100 (higher scores indicate better function).

measure.title: CIRS-G Score
measure.description: The Cumulative Illness Rating Scale for Geriatrics (CIRS-G) is used to quantify chronic illness burden from the medical records. Higher scores indicate greater burden.

outcome.title: Change in Barthel Index Score
outcome.description: Barthel Index scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating greater levels of function.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Discharge, an average of 24 days.
outcome.population: One Standard of Care participant did not have a baseline Barthel completed. Otherwise, all other 228 participants were included in the analysis.

group.title: Standard of Care Rehabilitation
group.description: Standard of Care Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

group.title: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation
group.description: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.

measure.title: Change in Barthel Index Score
measure.description: Barthel Index scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating greater levels of function.
measure.population: One Standard of Care participant did not have a baseline Barthel completed. Otherwise, all other 228 participants were included in the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: This Primary analysis used a marginal model with time (baseline and discharge), condition (EMR vs SOC), and time x condition as fixed effects, with an unstructured covariance structure specified, based on Bayesian information criteria (BIC).
analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value refers to the time by group interaction. The a priori threshold for statistical significance in this planned primary test was p<0.05.

outcome.title: Gait Speed (Determined by 4 or 10 Meter Walk Test)
outcome.time_frame: Discharge, an average of 24 days after baseline.
outcome.population: All participants with a gait speed at discharge were included in the analysis.

group.title: Standard of Care Rehabilitation
group.description: Standard of Care Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

group.description: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.

measure.title: Gait Speed (Determined by 4 or 10 Meter Walk Test)
measure.population: All participants with a gait speed at discharge were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Distance Ambulated in 6-Minute Walk Test
outcome.time_frame: Discharge, an average of 24 days after baseline.
outcome.population: All participants able to perform a 6-minute walk at discharge were included in the analysis.

group.description: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.

measure.title: Distance Ambulated in 6-Minute Walk Test
measure.population: All participants able to perform a 6-minute walk at discharge were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Self-reported Barthel Index
outcome.description: Barthel Index scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating greater levels of function. Conducted as a self-report at timepoints where patient was not in an institutional setting.
outcome.time_frame: 30, 60, and 90 Days Post Admission to the SNF
outcome.population: Any participant with data at either 30 days, 60 days, 90 days, or at discharge were included in the analyses.

group.title: Standard of Care Rehabilitation
group.description: Standard of Care Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

group.title: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation
group.description: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.

measure.title: Self-reported Barthel Index
measure.description: Barthel Index scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating greater levels of function. Conducted as a self-report at timepoints where patient was not in an institutional setting.
measure.population: Any participant with data at either 30 days, 60 days, 90 days, or at discharge were included in the analyses.

analysis.groups_desc: This Primary analysis used a marginal model with time (baseline and discharge), condition (EMR vs SOC), and time x condition as fixed effects, with an unstructured covariance structure specified, based on Bayesian information criteria (BIC).
analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value refers to the time by group interaction. The statistical significance in this test was p<0.05.

outcome.title: Discharge Disposition
outcome.description: Number of participants discharged from skilled nursing facility to home
outcome.time_frame: Discharge, an average of 24 days after baseline.
outcome.population: Any participant with a discharge disposition of either 'to home' or 'to institution' were included in the analysis.

group.title: Standard of Care Rehabilitation
group.description: Standard of Care Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

group.title: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation
group.description: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.

measure.title: Discharge Disposition
measure.description: Number of participants discharged from skilled nursing facility to home
measure.population: Any participant with a discharge disposition of either 'to home' or 'to institution' were included in the analysis.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value is calculated from a 2x2 Contingency Table consisting of rows that represent Discharged Home Vs Discharged to Institution and columns that represent the EMR and SOC groups.

outcome.title: Rehospitalizations
outcome.description: Assesses whether the participant was readmitted to the hospital.
outcome.time_frame: Days 30, 60, and 90 post admission to a SNF as well as at Discharge
outcome.population: Any participant with at least one re-hospitalization at day 30, day 60, day 90 or at discharge was included in the analysis.

group.title: Standard of Care Rehabilitation
group.description: Standard of Care Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

group.title: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation
group.description: Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists trained in Enhanced Medical Rehabilitation. This training focuses on improved communication, patient engagement, and intensity.

measure.title: Rehospitalizations
measure.description: Assesses whether the participant was readmitted to the hospital.
measure.population: Any participant with at least one re-hospitalization at day 30, day 60, day 90 or at discharge was included in the analysis.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value is calculated from a 2x2 Contingency Table consisting of rows that represent Yes/No Rehospitalization and columns that represent the EMR and SOC groups.

reported_events.desc: All cause mortality was tracked for 90 days.

group.title: Standard of Care Rehabilitation
group.description: Standard of Care Rehabilitation: Daily PT/OT provided by therapists not trained in the treatment intervention.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
